Marquardt District 15 Food & Nutrition Services began their meal program this week, which will occur on Mondays and Wednesdays. K-8 students will receive 2 days of meals (breakfast & lunch) on Mondays and 3 days of meals on Wednesdays (breakfast & lunch). All meals are served at no charge to enrolled students. Click here for school specific pick up times: https://www.d15foodandnutrition.us/index.php?sid=0512112116560271&page=menus.

Students do not need to be present to pick up meals. Parents/guardians can pick up for students. Please bring student meal ID card. No pre-order required. If you have students at two different schools, please pick up at one location. If for some reason you can not pick up meals at the times listed on the website, please contact Sandy Voss, Director of Food Services at svoss@d15.us who will work to accommodate families on a case by case basis.

On November 13th, this hard-working crew performed a morning show for 2nd graders from Black Hawk, Hall, Reskin, and Winnebago, who were bused in for the special event. Later in the evening, the troupe performed again to a packed house of families and fellow students.

Kudos to speech and drama teacher--and assistant director-- Ms. Budde, and the dozen other staff members and administrators who helped prepare our students for their big day. A huge thank you, also, to the parents who supported these starry-eyed Mustangs. Their future is bright!

Tuesday evening, Marquardt School District 15's Board of Education gathered together students, families, staff, and community members and partners to mark the completion of Winnebago Elementary School's renovation and expansion.

250 students, teachers, and parents gathered the Legat Architects: Sustainability Performance Design-designed gymnasium expansion for the ribbon-cutting ceremony before touring the new commons, early learning addition, STEAM Lab, and playground.

A special thank you and shout out to the Winnebago Elementary School PTO and Winnebago parents who contributed $22,951 toward the renovation and expansion of Winnebago's playground. Simply amazing!
